oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Viet Nam support petition
Vietnam support petition
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: MTSU, under ASB President Bert Wakeley, headed a state-wide petition effort in universities to show support of Johnson's Vietnam war policies. MTSU's petition was more than thirty-five feet long.
Harold Smith, ASB vice-president; Tom Peterson, freshman-class president; Bert Wakeley, ASB president

THE VIET NAM SUPPORT PETITION of more than 35 feet in length is pictured above in the hands of Harold Smith, ASB vice-president, at left; Tom Peterson, recently elected freshman class president, at center, and Bert Wakeley, ASB President, at right. The signature-filled paper was presented to Governor Frank Clement this weekend for transmission to President Lyndon B. Johnson and thus to the Armed Services in Viet Nam.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Associated Student Body
Vietnam War, 1961-1975--Public opinion; Petitions; Middle Tennessee State University
